crm.name: CRM Search
crm.description: This project is a lightweight, web-based tool for searching and retrieving client information within a CRM system. Built using Google Sites for the front end, Google Apps Script for front- and back-end functionality, and Google Sheets as the database, the solution enables efficient client lookup by leveraging layered caching and flexible querying. Designed to streamline client data access, this tool demonstrates a scalable approach for integrating search features into Google Workspace.

features.title: Dynamic Search
features.description: Allows users to quickly search for clients by name, phone number, email, or all combined for streamlined data access.

features.title: Flexible Querying
features.description: Supports querying by both column name and index, enabling easier data access and maintainable code.

features.title: Layered Caching
features.description: Implements a layered caching system to reduce load times and enhance data retrieval speed.

features.title: Scalable Structure
features.description: Designed for scalability, with potential for expanding into a full CRM with additional features like tracking and reporting.

description.text: Google Sites with Apps Script and Google Sheets

crm.demo_details: The demo showcases how users can perform exact searches and query data using either column names or column indices. You can explore the Demo yourself, and here are links to the database and the underlying AppScript code.

get_my_paper.name: Get My Paper
get_my_paper.description: GetMyPaper is a Python script designed to search for academic papers based on keywords and download the PDF files from various websites, including academic.oup.com, link.springer.com, onlinelibrary.wiley.com, and others. The script retrieves papers matching the search criteria and saves them locally. Each downloaded file contains information such as author names, website/journal name, publication year, and paper title.

features.title: Keyword Search
features.description: Enables users to input keywords for their search, which the script uses to search across multiple websites simultaneously.

features.title: Website Selection
features.description: Allows users to choose the specific websites they want to search for papers, offering flexibility and customization.

features.title: PDF Download
features.description: Downloads PDF files from the selected websites, starting from specified pages of the search results. Users can choose to download additional files as needed.

features.title: File Structure
features.description: Organizes downloaded PDF files with metadata such as author names, website/journal name, publication year, and paper title. This structured approach simplifies the management and referencing of downloaded papers.

description.text:
Journal of Consumer Research (JCR)
Journal of Consumer Psychology (JCP)
Journal of Marketing (JM)
Journal of Marketing Research (JMR)
Journal of Public Policy & Marketing (JPPM)
Marketing Science (MKS)
Management Science (MGS)
Psychology & Marketing (PM)
Journal of the Academy of Marketing Science (JAMS)

itrust2.name: iTrust2
itrust2.description:
iTrust2 originated as a project for the CSC326 Software Engineering course in the Computer Science Department at NC State University. It is primarily maintained by Kai Presler-Marshall and Sarah Heckman. The goal of iTrust2 is to immerse students in software engineering practices through a substantial, relevant, and evolving application that incorporates security and privacy requirements. If you're interested in using iTrust2 for your software engineering course, please don't hesitate to get in touch with us.

iTrust2 is an electronic health records system (EHR) designed to empower patients to manage their health records and communicate with their healthcare providers (HCPs). Healthcare providers can use iTrust2 to document office visits, including basic health metrics, diagnoses, prescriptions, eye care, and pregnancy care. iTrust2 adheres to HIPAA regulations to ensure the security and privacy of patient records.

features.title: Prescriptions
features.description: Allows healthcare providers to manage prescriptions for patients, including creating, updating, and tracking prescriptions.

features.title: Diagnoses
features.description: Records and manages diagnoses for patients, helping to keep track of their medical conditions and treatment plans.

features.title: Password Functionality
features.description: Enhances the security of the system by enabling users to change their passwords and ensuring that passwords meet security requirements.

features.title: Edit Demographics
features.description: Update patient demographics, ensuring that the information in the system is accurate and up to date.

technology_stack:
Backend: Java EE, REST API
Frontend: AngularJS, Javascript, HTML, CSS
Database: MySQL/MariaDB
Testing: Spring, JUnit, Cucumber & Selenium
Deployment: Jenkins

logjam.name: Logjam.Next
logjam.description: Logjam.Next was developed specifically for NetApp to address the unique challenges they face in managing and analyzing log data. NetApp, as a leading provider of data management solutions, handles vast amounts of log data from various sources. Logjam.Next aims to enhance NetApp's ability to process and analyze this data efficiently, providing them with valuable insights to improve their products and services. By leveraging the latest technologies and best practices in log processing, Logjam.Next is tailored to meet NetApp's specific requirements, ensuring seamless integration and optimal performance within their existing infrastructure.

features.title: Parallel Processing
features.description: Processes nodes in parallel, allowing for faster and more efficient log analysis, especially when handling large volumes of data.

features.title: Task Resumption
features.description: Picks up the last interrupted task and resumes work from that point. This ensures that log processing tasks can be resumed without loss of progress, even in the event of interruptions or failures.

features.title: Abnormal Log Detection
features.description: Detects abnormal logs, which is crucial for identifying potential issues or anomalies within the system.

features.title: Interactive Web Interface
features.description: Provides an interactive web interface, which makes it easier for users to analyze and understand the log data visually.

technology_stack:
Backend: Python, Flask, REST APIs
Frontend: Vue.js
Data Storage: ElasticSearch
CI/CD: Docker
logjam.demo_details: The video above illustrates the flow of Logjam.Next, a log processing tool. Data is initially stored in NFS. If the data is zipped, nodes are extracted. Multiple threads are then utilized to process these nodes in parallel, improving program speed as this is a bottleneck. The extracted nodes are inserted into ElasticSearch using REST APIs.

genshin.name: Genshin Impact Planner
genshin.description:
The motivation behind developing this app was to address the challenge of efficiently managing and tracking the upgrade progress of multiple characters and weapons simultaneously in Genshin Impact. With the game's complex upgrade system requiring different materials and priorities for each character and weapon, it can be overwhelming to keep track of everything manually.

This app simplifies the process by automating the calculation of required materials, displaying availability based on the day of the week, and providing a prioritization system for efficient resource allocation. Additionally, it seeks to automate repeated tasks, further enhancing the convenience and efficiency of managing upgrades. It aims to enhance the gaming experience by offering a convenient tool for players to plan and optimize their upgrade strategies, ultimately saving time and enhancing overall gameplay enjoyment.

features.title: Resource Planning
features.description: Automates the calculation and display of materials needed to level up talents for each character and weapon, saving significant planning time.

features.title: Priority Setting
features.description: Allows users to prioritize materials with H/M/L (High/Medium/Low) for weekly planning.

features.title: Weekly Summary
features.description: Generates a summary table indicating which materials to focus on each day of the week.

features.title: Data Insertion
features.description: Provides the ability to add new characters, weapons, and their materials in a separate sheet for database updates.

technology_stack:
Languages: Google Sheets functions and Google Apps Script.
Data: Genshin Impact Wiki
genshin.demo_details:
Users can input character names into the sheet, with the needed materials automatically populated on the right in grey text (as this detail is less important for user interaction). Users only need to focus on entering data in the columns highlighted in black. Users can then specify the priority as H/M/L, or leave it blank for future planning. The process for managing weapons is identical to managing characters. For materials that can only be gained on specific days of the week, we provide the weekly summary table. To track materials that can be obtained throughout the week, panels of grouped rows are provided, such as ascension materials from bosses and talent materials from weekly bosses.

Users have the ability to add new characters to the sheet. For instance, in the demo, we add a character named "Test" along with the required materials. Upon returning to the Resource Planner, the information is correctly populated if "Test" is entered, enabling users to manage this new character similarly to existing ones. The spreadsheet also supports weapon addition, which is not demonstrated in the video.

code_flow.name: Code Flow Visualizer
code_flow.description: The Code Flow Visualizer is a Python program designed to help users understand and visualize the flow of custom programming languages. By generating code that can be used with Graphviz, it provides a clear, graphical representation of control flow. This tool is especially useful for educational purposes, allowing students and developers to see how different parts of the code interact with each other.

features.title: IR Visualization
features.description: Translates custom language code into an intermediate representation.

features.title: Graphviz Code Generation
features.description: Converts the IR into Graphviz code for easy visualization.

features.title: Support for Control Structures
features.description: Handles complex control structures like if-else and loops, accurately reflecting the branching and looping behavior in the generated code.

features.title: Function Call Visualization
features.description: Showcases interactions and data flow between functions.

code_flow.demo_details: Above is a demonstration of the Code Flow Visualizer in action. On the left, you'll find code written in our custom programming language. On the right, you'll see the graph generated by our program and Graphviz, visually representing the code's control flow. In future versions of the Code Flow Visualizer, we plan to implement a feature that directly generates Graphviz graphs using an API. This enhancement will streamline the visualization process, allowing users to generate and view graphs directly within the program without the need to manually copy and paste code into the Graphviz website. This improvement will enhance the user experience and make the tool more efficient for visualizing code flow.

audio_summary.name: Audio Summary
audio_summary.description: AudioSummary empowers users to unlock the essence of spoken content effortlessly. Transforming lengthy audio files into concise, informative summaries, it saves time and enhances productivity. With AudioSummary, dive deeper into the world of audio content, uncovering key insights with ease.

features.title: Speech-to-Text
features.description: Utilizes the Hugging Face Transformers library for speech recognition, converting audio content from uploaded files or URLs into text.

features.title: Prompt Template
features.description: Chains together language models (LLAMA-2 model) with prompt templates to facilitate the summarization process, allowing for more coherent and accurate summaries.

features.title: LLM-Powered Summarization
features.description: Utilizes the LLAMA-2 model for advanced language model-based summarization.

features.title: Audio File Management
features.description: Manages audio files for processing, including downloading and deleting temporary files.

technology_stack:
Languages: Python, Gradio
Libraries: Langchain, Hugging Face Transformers, IBM Watson, IBM WatsonxLLM Extension, Llama

file_assistant.name: File Assistant
file_assistant.description:
File Assistant is an AI application designed for conversational question-answering based on uploaded documents. The goal is to analyze and extract valuable information from a variety of file types, including PDFs, Word documents, text files, and presentations. Leveraging advanced natural language processing (NLP) algorithms, File Assistant can understand the content within these files and provide users with meaningful insights. Its intuitive interface allows users to easily upload files and interact with the AI to gain a deeper understanding of their documents.

The motivation behind File Assistant stems from the increasing complexity of document analysis in today's digital landscape. With the exponential growth of digital content, users are faced with the challenging task of extracting relevant information from a vast amount of data. File Assistant aims to simplify this process by automating document analysis tasks using AI. By offering a tool that can analyze and extract insights from files, File Assistant empowers users to make informed decisions and derive actionable insights from their documents.

features.title: Document Analysis
features.description: Supports various document formats (PDF, DOC, DOCX, TXT) and splits documents into text chunks for efficient processing.

features.title: Question-Answering Chain
features.description: Offers a conversational interface to inquire about document content. This is achieved through the integration of the Language Model (LLM) and the embeddings database.

features.title: LLM Integration
features.description: Utilizes the LLAMA2_model from IBM WatsonX to generate responses using user queries and conversation history.

features.title: Embeddings Database
features.description: Creates an embeddings database using Chroma for representing text data, enabling efficient retrieval of information from documents.

features.title: Context Management
features.description: Maintains conversation history to retain context and provide personalized responses over time.

technology_stack:
Languages: Python, Flask, HTML, Javascript
Libraries: Langchain (RetrievalQA, RecursiveCharacterTextSplitter, Chroma, document_loaders), IBM Watson Machine Learning (WatsonxLLM, Model)

career_advisor.name: CareerBoost
career_advisor.description:
CareerBoost is driven by a commitment to revolutionize the job search experience, recognizing the challenges individuals face in crafting compelling application materials and navigating the intricacies of the hiring process. In response, CareerBoost offers a user-friendly platform that leverages AI and natural language processing to provide personalized guidance and support. It aims to empower job seekers by simplifying the process and helping them stand out to potential employers.

To achieve its goals, CareerBoost employs advanced natural language processing (NLP) algorithms to analyze and extract insights from various text-based documents, including resumes, job descriptions, and cover letters. These algorithms enable CareerBoost to understand the context and meaning of the content, allowing for tailored feedback and actionable recommendations. Furthermore, CareerBoost utilizes machine learning techniques to continuously enhance its advice based on user interactions. By analyzing user feedback and outcomes, CareerBoost refines its algorithms and suggestions to better meet the needs of job seekers, ultimately improving their chances of success in the job market.

In addition to its technical sophistication, CareerBoost prioritizes user experience through intuitive design and seamless integration with existing document formats. The platform's user-friendly interfaces and interactive features aim to streamline the process of optimizing application materials and generating personalized job search strategies. With CareerBoost, job seekers can approach their job search with confidence, knowing they have a powerful tool to support them in achieving their career goals.

features.title: Document Analysis
features.description: Utilizes advanced natural language processing (NLP) algorithms to analyze and extract insights from user input

features.title: LLM Integration
features.description: Utilizes the LLAMA2_model from IBM WatsonX to generate responses using user queries.

features.title: Personalized Recommendations
features.description: Provides personalized recommendations and suggestions based on the analysis of user-provided documents

technology_stack: Python, Gradio, IBM Watson Machine Learning (WatsonxLLM, Model)
career_advisor.demo_details:
In the Consult Advisor section, users can receive personalized advice by inputting details such as the position they are applying for, the job description, and their resume content. CareerBoost analyzes this information and provides tailored recommendations to improve the effectiveness of their application.

The Polish Resume feature allows users to refine their resume content by entering the position name, their resume content, and optional instructions for improvement. CareerBoost offers suggestions to enhance the quality and presentation of their resume, helping them to stand out to potential employers.

The Generate Cover Letter tool enables users to create a compelling cover letter by specifying the company name, position name, job description, and resume content. CareerBoost generates a well-crafted cover letter that highlights their qualifications and interest in the position, increasing their chances of securing an interview.

image_narrate.name: Image Narrate
image_narrate.description: The Image Captioning Web App is a powerful tool that utilizes state-of-the-art AI technology to generate descriptive captions for images. Powered by the "Salesforce/blip-image-captioning-base" model from the Hugging Face Transformers library, this web app provides users with a seamless and intuitive way to add textual context to their images.

features.title: AI-Powered Caption Generation
features.description: Leverages advanced deep learning models to analyze uploaded images and generate descriptive captions automatically.

features.title: Image Upload
features.description: Provides intuitive interface to upload images and view the generated captions.

technology_stack:
Languages: Python, Gradio
Libraries: Hugging Face Transformers, BlipForConditionalGeneration, NumPy, PIL

nutriplan.name: NutriPlan
nutriplan.description: NutriPlan is designed to address the critical need for improved nutrition and health habits. Research shows that up to 80% of heart disease, stroke, and type 2 diabetes, as well as up to 40% of cancer cases, could be prevented by adopting healthier eating habits, engaging in regular physical activity, and quitting tobacco use. NutriPlan aims to empower users to make these positive lifestyle changes by providing a convenient and effective tool for meal planning and nutrition tracking.

features.title: Recipe Recommendations
features.description: Provides users with healthy recipe suggestions to inspire and diversify their meal choices while aligning with their dietary preferences and restrictions.

features.title: Progress Tracking
features.description: Enables users to monitor their progress towards their fitness & nutrition goals, including weight management and overall health improvement.

features.title: User Profile & Preferences
features.description: Generates customized meal plans based on individual health goals, nutritional needs, and allergen restrictions.

features.title: Food Database
features.description: Provides informed calorie and nutrition information to make educated meal choices.

time_manager.name: Time Manager
time_manager.description: The Time Manager App is designed to optimize your daily schedule by predicting the time required to complete various tasks and fitting them into your calendar. Leveraging machine learning, this app processes data from three key files—Tasks_Training.xlsx, Events_test.txt, and Tasks_test.xlsx—to train a model that accurately estimates task durations and schedules them efficiently. Additionally, the app seamlessly integrates with Google Calendar to automatically create events for your tasks.

features.title: Model Training & Prediction
features.description: Trains a machine learning model using the data from Tasks_Training.xlsx to predict the time required for tasks listed in Tasks_test.xlsx.

features.title: User Preferences
features.description: Prompts the user to input their preferred working hours, aiming to schedule tasks within these time blocks.

features.title: Task Scheduling
features.description: Fits the tasks into the user's preferred working hours while meeting the specified deadlines. It ensures that there are no conflicts with events already scheduled in the calendar.

features.title: Google Calendar Integration
features.description: Connects to Google Calendar to automatically create events for the scheduled tasks. This feature ensures that all tasks are seamlessly integrated into the user's existing calendar, enhancing organization and productivity.

technology_stack:
Tech: Python, Sklearn
Data: Tasks_Training.xlsx, Events_test.txt, Tasks_test.xlsx
time_manager.demo_details:
In this demo, the app aims to efficiently manage tasks and events within a user's schedule. On the left side of the screen, users can view their input files, which include existing events and tasks to complete. On the right side, the app dynamically organizes these tasks to fit into the user's preferred working hours while respecting specified deadlines and avoiding conflicts with existing events. If certain tasks cannot be accommodated within the preferred working hours, the app notifies the user with a warning message advising them to use their leisure time for these tasks.

The app also integrates with Google Calendar, allowing users to see the scheduled tasks added to their calendar. Users can choose to hide these tasks by unselecting the "Time Manager Suggested" calendar. Additionally, by connecting their Google Calendar to the app, users can enable automatic creation of events for the scheduled tasks, ensuring that only tasks that fit into their preferred working time are added to the calendar.

mmtrip.name: MMTrip
mmtrip.description:
The motivation behind MMTrip stems from the increasing complexity of urban transportation systems and the growing demand for efficient and integrated mobility solutions. With the expansion of urbanization, there has been a rise in the variety of transportation modes available, ranging from public transport to ride-sharing services and cycling options. However, this diversity also complicates the process of trip planning, requiring individuals to navigate through multiple options and considerations to find the optimal route.

MMTrip aims to address these challenges by providing a comprehensive and user-friendly solution for multi-modal trip planning. By integrating various modes of transportation, including flights, public transport, driving, walking, and biking, MMTrip offers users a holistic view of their travel options. The ability to personalize trips based on preferences such as time, cost, and comfort, as well as constraints like maximum walking distance, further enhances the user experience.

Additionally, MMTrip leverages machine learning-powered algorithms for accurate prediction of trip costs and real-time updates on route availability. This not only simplifies the trip planning process but also ensures that users are equipped with the most up-to-date information for their journey.

In summary, MMTrip is motivated by the need for a comprehensive, integrated, and user-centric approach to trip planning in urban environments. By offering a seamless and personalized experience, MMTrip aims to make multi-modal travel more accessible, efficient, and enjoyable for users.

features.title: Multi-Modal Routing
features.description: One-click access to door-to-door routes considering combinations of flights, public transit, driving, biking, and walking.

features.title: Trip Personalization
features.description: Personalize your trip by choosing the number of travelers and luggage, mode of transportation, constraints, and preference options.

features.title: Interactive Visualization
features.description: Provides comprehensive trip details such as Uber fare forecasts, direct booking links, and points of interest (POI) lookup on the map.

features.title: Cost Prediction
features.description: Utilizes a machine learning-powered fare prediction model for estimating future prices, as Uber and Lyft only offer real-time quoting systems.

technology_stack:
Languages: Python, Django, React, AWS
Data: Uber Fare, Historical Uber Rides, World's Airports
APIs: Google Maps, Directions, SerpAPI, OpenStreetMap, Overpass

description.text: 1st Place of IISE-CIS Mobile App Competition

mmtrip.demo_details:
From the home page, users can input their trip details, including travel locations, dates, number of bags, passengers, and preferred transportation modes. They can opt to have MMtrip select flights for them, which then directs them to the routes page. Here, a similar search bar is available with additional filtering options to refine the displayed routes in a table format. Each row represents a route option and displays details such as departure and arrival times, duration, route specifics, cost, and a booking link.

Clicking on a specific route row will display the route on a map. Icons within the route details cell become clickable, allowing users to zoom in to view nodes and edges. Hovering over different edges reveals more details such as travel time, transportation mode, duration, cost, bus lines, and number of stops. Clicking on a node displays the node's address, arrival/departure times, and options to view points of interest (POIs).

Users also have the option to select their own flights. On the Flight Selection page, various filtering options are provided, including airports, number of stops, airlines, price, times, duration, and flight class. The available flights are displayed in a table showing airline, time, airports, duration, stops, carbon dioxide emissions, and price. Clicking on a flight provides more detailed information, such as layover times and flight numbers. After selecting their preferred flight(s), users can click continue, and MMtrip will generate routes based on their selections.

Once users are satisfied with their chosen route, they can click on the booking link to proceed with flight booking, with MMtrip attempting to pre-fill the necessary information.
